content: The "Workers' Political Rights Act" limits contributions and expenditures by labor organizations. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" limits contributions and expenditures by labor organizations. Amendments to the Federal Election Campaign Act include requirements for labor organizations to provide written notification to employees regarding political activities. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" mandates that labor organizations must provide written notification to employees within 30 days of employment, informing them that they cannot be required to pay for the organization's political activities. Employees have the option to pay an agency fee instead of joining the labor organization, limited to the cost of exclusive representation services. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" allows employees to pay an agency fee instead of membership dues to a labor organization, limited to the cost of exclusive representation services and a reduction for political activities. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" mandates that labor organizations calculate the cost of exclusive representation services and political spending based on the previous fiscal year. It also requires an annual independent financial examination to verify claimed expenses. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" mandates an annual independent financial examination by a certified public accountant to verify claimed expenses of a labor organization for exclusive representation services. The examination must adhere to auditing standards and include procedures for determining costs chargeable to agency fee payors. If challenged, an impartial decision maker must be provided for a review process overseen by the National Labor Relations Board or a court. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" requires an annual independent financial examination by a certified public accountant to verify a labor organization's claimed expenses for exclusive representation services. If challenged, an impartial decision maker will oversee a review process, with disputed amounts placed in escrow. Labor organizations failing to meet certain requirements must finance specified expenditures only with funds legally collected under the Act. The amendments made by section 2 of the "Workers' Political Rights Act" will apply to contributions and expenditures made after the enactment date of the Act.
